description.narrative: Capacities developed for the implementation of strategic reforms in quality management and standards and teacher development, which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Quality of basic education and learning outcomes improved for all children

sector.narrative: Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Other activities for equitable access to quality education e.g. school feeding, school grants
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
Provision of parental education for school readiness (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision or procurement of primary education learning materials
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacities developed for the implementation of strategic reforms in quality management and standards and teacher development

description.narrative: Improving the quality of primary education services is key to promoting greater learning among children. Improved teaching and governance is fundamental to improving quality, which is why UNICEF supported implementation of the national in-service teacher training strategy for primary teachers and the revision of national quality standards for primary schools. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/01/2017

title.narrative: Number of teachers trained by the ZIP Coordinators

actual.value: 2017:The training delivery strategy has changed in line with the National In-Service Teacher training Strategy. Training by ZIP Coordinators has been discontinued. In 2015, approximately, 1,000 teachers received training on the 4 modules in the Manual de Métodos de Ensino-Aprendizagem Participativa. Now,

title.narrative: Primary teachers who received training with funding provided by UNICEF

actual.value: 2016:The Education Common Fund, to which UNICEF contributes, was used to implement national in-service teacher training that reached 730 experience primary teachers in the target provinces of Tete and Zambézia, and a total of over 9,000 primary teachers benefited from the exchange of experience and pedag

title.narrative: b2a. Availability, in schools supported by UNICEF, of quality CFS/CFE standards that are consistent with Child Friendly Schools/education or similar models - score (1-4), see guidance
Capacity development plan for teacher training institutions and ZIPs approved
